Text: Weather
Scientific projects related to the weather & forecast
Galesniffer's Totem
Warnings of the next weather come {0:+#} day earlier.
A simple pole where your beavers can 'sniff' the wind for early weather hints.
Mistweaver's Dial
Warnings of the next weather come {0:+#} day earlier.
A dial that can predict the weather based on the humidity and air pressure.
Thunderhub's Spire
Warnings of the next weather come {0:+#} day earlier per Level.
A tall spire that can detect the electric charge in the air.
[Cost] per Level on pre-warning days. 0 on all other days.
Weather Forecasting
Predict the next weather. The accuracy starts at {0:#%} at the first day and increases by {1:+#%} every day.
Beavers consult the clouds and winds, their predictions sharpening as the days pass.
Starlit Precision
Weather Forecasting now starts with additional {0:+#%} accuracy on the first day of the stage.
'The stars don't lie—if you know how to ask them!' — Blink the Stargazer
Hydrological Analysis
Add {1:+#%} accuracy per Level to Weather Forecasting everyday.
By studying the ebb and flow, beavers refine their weather guesses daily.
Flowmaster's Conduit
Allow you to increase the strength of Water sources
'More water, more power—simple as that!' — Riverchew Flowmaster
Increase fresh water sources
Increase the Strength of all fresh water sources (including during Badtides) by {0:+#%} per Level
Increase bad water sources
Increase the Strength of all bad water sources by {0:+#%} per Level
Tidebreaker's Gate
Allow you to decrease the strength of Water sources
'Sometimes you need to tame the river, not ride it.' — Stillwater Tidebreaker
Decrease fresh water sources
Decrease the Strength of all fresh water sources by {0:;#%} per Level
Decrease bad water sources
Decrease the Strength of all bad water sources by {0:#%} per Level
[Cost] per fresh water source. Inactive sources do not count (for e.g. during drought)
[Cost] per bad water source. Inactive sources do not count (for e.g. during drought or sealed ones)
A marvel of beaver engineering, this gate tames the wildest rivers, calming their flow to protect our lands.
Channeling nature's might, this conduit unleashes a surge of water, bending rivers to our will.
